sentences.text: during a test with piuparts I noticed your package starts processes where it shouldnt.
This is very probably due to not using invoke-rc.d as mandated by policy 9.3.3.2.
>From the attached log (scroll to the bottom...):
This should not have happened - policy-rc.d would have prevented starting tomcat.
COMMAND   PID       USER   FD   TYPE DEVICE SIZE/OFF     NODE NAME
Also note the error in the config script, use
I've prepared an NMU for biomaj-watcher (versioned as 1.2.0-3.1) and
Please feel free to tell me if I
: :' : Debian GNU/Linux user, admin, and developer  -  http://www.debian.org/
`'  Member of VIBE!AT & SPI, fellow of the Free Software Foundation Europe
`-   NP: Jim Carrey: Somebody To Love
Le Thu, Feb 09, 2012 at 11:49:06PM +0100, gregor herrmann a crit :
> I've prepared an NMU for biomaj-watcher (versioned as 1.2.0-3.1) and
Please feel free to tell me if I > should delay it longer.
Could you commit your changes in our Subversion repository and tag the version ?
On Fri, 10 Feb 2012 08:45:21 +0900, Charles Plessy wrote:
> > I've prepared an NMU for biomaj-watcher (versioned as 1.2.0-3.1) and
Please feel free to tell me if I > > should delay it longer.
Could you commit your changes in our Subversion > repository and tag the version ?
I tried but I have to admit that I'm failing miserably.

has some changes since the last tag (actually also exactly the ones I made for the NMU -- yes I should have checked before), and I have no idea how to tag a revision that has only my changes but not has what happened since then in svn.
I can of course just add the changelog entry and commit it;
or I can also cancel the NMU and you can upload -4 as it is in svn;
Or maybe you have some other ideas :)
: :' : Debian GNU/Linux user, admin, and developer  -  http://www.debian.org/
`'  Member of VIBE!AT & SPI, fellow of the Free Software Foundation Europe
I already fixed the issue on SVN, but I am waiting for a translation review end before uploading the package (that will fix all translation bugs).
Could you please remove the NMU upload.
Next upload will contain the fix.

> I've prepared an NMU for biomaj-watcher (versioned as 1.2.0-3.1) and
Please feel free to tell me if I > should delay it longer.

We believe that the bug you reported is fixed in the latest version of biomaj-watcher, which is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive:
A summary of the changes between this version and the previous one is attached.
Thank you for reporting the bug, which will now be closed.
If you have further comments please address them to 657478@bugs.debian.org, and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.
Olivier Sallou <olivier.sallou@irisa.fr> (supplier of updated biomaj-watcher package)
(This message was generated automatically at their request;
if you believe that there is a problem with it please contact the archive administrators by mailing ftpmaster@debian.org)
biomaj-watcher - biological data-bank updater - web interface
* Debconf templates and debian/control reviewed by the debian-l10n-      english team as part of the Smith review project.
* postinst: use invoke-rc.d instead of service to
restart tomcat (Closes: #657478) and add quotes to test
